unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: telecommunications: fiber to home expansion gains momentum in india

unnormalised: New Delhi – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their fiber-to-home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses with high-speed internet. The rollout plans focus on major metropolitan areas like Mumbai, Delhi, and Bengaluru, as well as tier-2 cities such as Lucknow and Jaipur.
normalised: new delhi – reliance jio and bharti airtel are aggressively expanding their fiber to home (F T T H) infrastructure across india, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses with high speed internet. the rollout plans focus on major metropolitan areas like mumbai, delhi, and bengaluru, as well as tier two cities such as lucknow and jaipur.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio recently announced the completion of 50,000 km of fiber deployment in the last quarter. Dr. Kiran Sharma, a leading telecom analyst, believes this rapid expansion will significantly boost India's digital economy.
normalised: reliance jio recently announced the completion of fifty thousand kilometer of fiber deployment in the last quarter. doctor kiran sharma, a leading telecom analyst, believes this rapid expansion will significantly boost india's digital economy.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel is focusing on providing bundled services, including broadband, DTH, and OTT subscriptions. They're targeting areas with high density residential complexes and commercial spaces, offering speeds up to 1 Gbps.
normalised: bharti airtel is focusing on providing bundled services, including broadband, D T H, and O T T subscriptions. they are targeting areas with high density residential complexes and commercial spaces, offering speeds up to one G B P S.

unnormalised: Analysts estimate that the average cost per connection is around Rs. 5,000. These FTTH connections can unlock value in smart homes, requiring stable and reliable internet connectivity for various IoT devices in areas as small as 500 sq ft. The increased bandwidth availability also supports the growing demand for online education and remote work options, mirroring the evolving lifestyle of the modern Indian family.
normalised: analysts estimate that the average cost per connection is around rupee five thousand. these F T T H connections can unlock value in smart homes, requiring stable and reliable internet connectivity for various I O T devices in areas as small as five hundred square feet. the increased bandwidth availability also supports the growing demand for online education and remote work options, mirroring the evolving lifestyle of the modern indian family.
